sentence.Network_en: Kitzi was an adept at getting people to talk confidentially to him.
sentence.Network_cn: 基齐很善于引导别人与其谈心。

sentence.Network_en: Nash hadn't raised his voice, still spoke rather softly, confidentially.
sentence.Network_cn: 纳什没有提高嗓门，依然悄声说着，相当轻柔。

sentence.Network_en: Confidentially, I am not sure that it wasn't above their heads.
sentence.Network_cn: 私底下说，我不敢肯定他们明白了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 次日伍廷芳又来访本馆，所以本使突然问他：本使自英国公使“私下地(confidentially)”听了这样的传闻，足下有没有听过它？伍氏表示 …
新编大学英语... ... commodity n. 商品； 有价值的东西 confidentially ad. 秘密地， 悄悄地 conversation n. (友好、 随便的) 谈话.
She told me confidentially that she is going to retire early ., 她私下告诉我她要提早退休.
Byconfidentially 副词：秘密地，亲密地；confidentiality 名词：保密性，机密性

list.abs: confidence testing 信心测验confidential data 保密资料confidentiality 保密性

Forex Stock Fund | 外汇股票基金 ... 保管机构 Custodian 保密协议 Confidentiality agreement 保险库 strong room,vault.

entry.tran: 私下地；只是你我之间说说
entry.def: Confidentially is used to say that what you are telling someone is a secret and should not be discussed with anyone else.

example.ex: Confidentially, I am not sure that it wasn't above their heads.
example.tran: 私底下说，我不敢肯定他们明白了。
